intro: Phellolophium decaryi, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grassland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some regions for its attractive foliage and blooms.
